title: The Equations of Motion
text: Use the formula: s=u*t+1/2*​a*t**2, where s is the distance $$(5.00$$ mi in this case), u is the initial velocity $$(60.0$$ $$\frac{mi}{h}$$ in this case), a is the acceleration $$(60.0$$ $$\frac{mi}{h}$$ converted to $$\frac{m}{s^2}$$ in this case), and $$t$$ is the time.

title: Time Calculation
text: Use the quadratic formula to solve for $$t$$ in the equation s=u*t+1/2*​a*t**2.
